job_description: Description AFCC requires a co-op student for an eight-month term to assist the CCM Component Research Team in working on catalyst development for automotive PEM fuel cells.The successful candidate will:• Participate in development of heterogeneous electrocatalyst systems and catalyst layers for proton exchange membrane fuel cells• Participate in the synthesis and evaluation of these structures for performance and durability• Evaluate the electrodes by performing standard electrochemical techniques such as cyclic voltammetry, AC impedance spectroscopy, etc• Gain experience in industrial research at the cutting edge of emerging energy technology• Analyze the data acquired and report results to management
job_requirements: Requirements/Skills Key job skills include:• Ability to be confident and safe in the laboratory• Good problem solving skills• Effective communication skills• Operating with limited supervision after training• Knowledge of standard MS Office softwareAreas of Study Physical Sciences, Materials ScienceAFCC values diversity in the workplace and is committed to Employment Equity.  We encourage applications from all qualified candidates.Open To All Majors:No
